channel.title: CodeAnalysis on Codewrecks
channel.description: Recent content in CodeAnalysis on Codewrecks

item.title: Getting code coverage result in drop folder during a TFS2010 buils
item.description: In a very old post I explained how to enable code coverage in TFS2010 builds and today I received a mail asking an interesting question. The question is: Is it possible to have Code Coverage result to be included in drop folder?. Answering this question is a two phase process, the first one is understanding where MsTest store results of code coverage and verify that is possible to do something useful with them.

item.title: Code analysis for Sql Project
item.description: I’m not a fanatic of Code Analysis, at least I know that it is quite impractical trying to remove all warning of fxcop analysis, but I strongly advice you to run code analysis on your code, and give it a shot from time to time. First of all is a good way to find potential bug, then you will always learn new and more standard way to write your code.
